item.title: Flag on pole in front of my house, 15th September
item.description:
There is a flag that was placed on the black pole (that says welcome to Crayford signpost) in front of my house (94 London Road), I would like this removed. It is very disruptive to my view as it is at the line of my window. Also it has been very windy of late and the constant sound of the flag fabric smacking the pole keeps waking me up at night, it also reflects a shadow in my room when the light comes on at night. Kindly take it down asap. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley Lane, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting not working, 15th September
item.description:
Street lighting has not been working for some time. Street lamps offer visibility to homeowners and pedestrians. Only one lamp working on the street and is not very bright. Looks like all other street lamps have been turned off
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Britannia Close, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unroadworthy car on public road, 15th September
item.description:
This car has been on axle stands for months. As per "The Road Traffic Act 1988 and associated Construction and Use Regulations", there is a requirement for vehicles on the road to be in a roadworthy state. This car is taxed, but it MOT exempt so the owner is using this loophole to keep what is basically a shell on the road. It has no wheels, or lights so it is not in a a roadworthy state so it needs to be removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101,103, Oakdene Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yesterday I reported to you about :"Wet dog fouling on the, which is near the kerb and is in front of 99Fernhead Road"., 15th September
item.description:
Yesterday I reported to you about :"Wet dog fouling on the pavement which is near the kerb and is in front 99 Fernhead Road, the fouling has been trodden in". The previous day I reported to you about about :"Wet dog fouling on the pavement which is besides a tree which is in front of 95 Fernhead Road". People get in and out their cars besides this tree and people cross the road besides this tree and children play near this tree. So far nothing has been done! About both reports concerning the fouling in front of 95 Fernhead Road and 99 Fernhead Road. Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
